alert.note: Alert for Frontier; Hayes (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 16 at 9:19PM CDT by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Frontier, southeastern Lincoln and northeastern Hayes Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 918 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, or 14 miles south of North Platte, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Curtis, Maxwell, Wellfleet, Lake Maloney State Recreation Area, Keith, Maywood, Cottonwood Canyon State Wildlife Management Area, Hansen Memorial Reserve State Wildlife Management Area and Somerset. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 180 and 196. Highway 83 between mile markers 49 and 80. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for southwestern Nebraska.
